command.frontMatter.contenttype.generate: Generate content type from current file
command.frontMatter.contenttype.addMissi: Add missing fields from front matter to content type
command.frontMatter.contenttype.setConte: Set the content type to use for the current file
command.frontMatter.createContent: Create new content from defined content type or template
command.frontMatter.exportTaxonomy: Export all tags & categories to your settings
command.frontMatter.generateSlug: Generate slug based on content title
command.frontMatter.markup.heading: Heading
command.frontMatter.chatbot: Ask the Front Matter AI for help
command.frontMatter.promoteSettings: Promote settings from local to team level
command.frontMatter.remap: Remap or remove tag/category in all articles
settings.configuration.title: Front Matter: use frontmatter.json for shared team settings
setting.frontMatter.projects.markdownDes: Specify the list of projects to load in the Front Matter CMS. [Check in the docs](https://frontmatter.codes/docs/settings/overview#frontmatter.projects)
setting.frontMatter.projects.items.prope: Specify the name of the project.
Specify if this project is the default project to load.
Specify if you want to enable AI suggestions. [Check in the docs](https://frontmatter.codes/docs/settings/overview#frontmatter.sponsors.ai.enabled)
setting.frontMatter.extensibility.script: Specify the list of scripts to load in the Front Matter CMS. [Check in the docs](https://frontmatter.codes/docs/settings/overview#frontmatter.extensibility.scripts)
setting.frontMatter.experimental.markdow: Specify if you want to enable the experimental features. [Check in the docs](https://frontmatter.codes/docs/settings/overview#frontmatter.experimental)
setting.frontMatter.extends.markdownDesc: Specify the list of paths/URLs to extend the Front Matter CMS config. [Check in the docs](https://frontmatter.codes/docs/settings/overview#frontmatter.extends)
setting.frontMatter.content.autoUpdateDa: Specify if you want to automatically update the modified date of your article/page (only content located in your content folder). [Check in the docs](https://frontmatter.codes/docs/settings/overview#frontmatter.content.autoupdatedate)
setting.frontMatter.content.defaultFileT: Specify the default file type for the content to create. [Check in the docs](https://frontmatter.codes/docs/settings/overview#frontmatter.content.defaultfiletype)
setting.frontMatter.content.defaultSorti: Specify the default sorting option for the content dashboard. You can use one of the values from the enum or define your own ID. [Check in the docs](https://frontmatter.codes/docs/settings/overview#frontmatter.content.defaultsorting)
setting.frontMatter.content.draftField.m: Define the draft field you want to use to manage your content. [Check in the docs](https://frontmatter.codes/docs/settings/overview#frontmatter.content.draftfield)
setting.frontMatter.content.draftField.p: Type of the draft field you want to use
Name of the field to use
By default the draft field is set to true when the content is a draft. Set this to true to set it to false.
List of choices for the field
Specify if you want to highlight the Front Matter in the Markdown file. [Check in the docs](https://frontmatter.codes/docs/settings/overview#frontmatter.content.fmhighlight)
setting.frontMatter.content.hideFm.markd: Specify if you want to hide the Front Matter in the Markdown file. [Check in the docs](https://frontmatter.codes/docs/settings/overview#frontmatter.content.hidefm)
setting.frontMatter.content.hideFmMessag: Specify the message to display when the Front Matter is hidden. [Check in the docs](https://frontmatter.codes/docs/settings/overview#frontmatter.content.hidefmMessage)
This array of folders defines where the extension can retrieve or create new pages. [Check in the docs](https://frontmatter.codes/docs/settings/overview#frontmatter.content.pagefolders)
Defines a custom preview path for the folder.
Defines a prefix for the file name.
Defines which content types can be used for the current location. If not defined, all content types will be available.
Disable the creation of new content in the folder.
Set the page folder as a default locale for the content. All content from this folder is translatable to the languages defined in the `frontMatter.content.i18n` setting.
setting.frontMatter.content.placeholders: This array of placeholders defines the placeholders that you can use in your content types and templates for automatically populating your content its front matter. [Check in the docs](https://frontmatter.codes/docs/settings/overview#frontmatter.content.placeholders)
ID of the placeholder, in your content type or template, use it as follows: {{placeholder}}
The script to execute to get the value of the placeholder
setting.frontMatter.content.publicFolder: Specify the folder name where all your assets are located. For instance in Hugo this is the `static` folder. [Check in the docs](https://frontmatter.codes/docs/settings/overview#frontmatter.content.publicfolder)
Specify the path of the assets folder
Defines if the path to your media files be relative to the content file?
setting.frontMatter.snippets.wrapper.ena: Specify if you want to wrap the snippets. [Check in the docs](https://frontmatter.codes/docs/settings/overview#frontMatter.snippets.wrapper.enabled)
setting.frontMatter.content.snippets.mar: Define the snippets you want to use in your content. [Check in the docs](https://frontmatter.codes/docs/settings/overview#frontmatter.content.snippets)
setting.frontMatter.content.sorting.mark: Define the sorting options for your dashboard content. [Check in the docs](https://frontmatter.codes/docs/settings/overview#frontmatter.content.sorting)
setting.frontMatter.content.sorting.item: The ID of the sorting option. This will be used for the storing the last used sorting option or the default option.
Name of the metadata field to sort by
setting.frontMatter.content.supportedFil: Specify the file types that you want to use in Front Matter. [Check in the docs](https://frontmatter.codes/docs/settings/overview#frontmatter.content.supportedfiletypes)
setting.frontMatter.content.wysiwyg.mark: Specifies if you want to enable/disable the What You See, Is What You Get (WYSIWYG) markdown controls. [Check in the docs](https://frontmatter.codes/docs/settings/overview#frontmatter.content.wysiwyg)
setting.frontMatter.content.filters.mark: Specify the filters you want to use for your content dashboard. [Check in the docs](https://frontmatter.codes/docs/settings/overview#frontmatter.content.filters)
setting.frontMatter.custom.scripts.markd: Specify the path to a Node.js script to execute. The current file path will be provided as an argument. [Check in the docs](https://frontmatter.codes/docs/settings/overview#frontmatter.custom.scripts)
setting.frontMatter.custom.scripts.items: Title you want to give to your script. Will be shown as the title of the button.
Path to the script to execute
Path to the node executable. This is required when using NVM, so that there is no confusion of which node version to use. (deprecated: use the command property instead)
Run the script for all content files
Define where you want to output your script output. Default is a notification, but you can specify to show it in an editor panel.
The type of output for the editor panel. Can be used to change it to 'markdown' for example
The type for which the script will be used.
The type of script you want to execute.
Hide the action from the UI
The environment type for which the script needs to be used
Path to the script to execute
Define the content types for which the script will be used. If none are defined, it will be available to all types.
setting.frontMatter.dashboard.content.pa: Specify if you want to enable/disable pagination for your content. You can define your page number up to 52. Default items per page is `16`. Disabling the pagination can be done by setting it to `false`. [Check in the docs](https://frontmatter.codes/docs/settings/overview#frontmatter.dashboard.content.pagination)
setting.frontMatter.dashboard.content.ca: Specify the name of the metadata field that will be used to show the tags on the content card. When empty or null, it will hide the tags from the card. [Check in the docs](https://frontmatter.codes/docs/settings/overview#frontmatter.dashboard.content.cardtags)
Specify if you want to show the state/draft status on the content card view. [Check in the docs](https://frontmatter.codes/docs/settings/overview#frontMatter.dashboard.content.card.fields.state)
Specify if you want to show the date on the content card view. [Check in the docs](https://frontmatter.codes/docs/settings/overview#frontMatter.dashboard.content.card.fields.date)

Specify the name of the metadata field that will be used to show the description on the content card. [Check in the docs](https://frontmatter.codes/docs/settings/overview#frontMatter.dashboard.content.card.fields.description)

Specify the name of the metadata field that will be used to show the title on the content card. [Check in the docs](https://frontmatter.codes/docs/settings/overview#frontMatter.dashboard.content.card.fields.title)
setting.frontMatter.dashboard.mediaSnipp: Specify the a snippet for your custom media insert markup. [Check in the docs](https://frontmatter.codes/docs/settings/overview#frontmatter.dashboard.mediasnippet)
Use the `{mediaUrl}`, `{caption}`, `{alt}`, `{filename}`, `{mediaHeight}`, and `{mediaWidth}` placeholders in your snippet to automatically insert the media information.
setting.frontMatter.dashboard.openOnStar: Specify if you want to open the dashboard when you start VS Code.  [Check in the docs](https://frontmatter.codes/docs/settings/overview#frontmatter.dashboard.openonstart)
setting.frontMatter.data.files.markdownD: Specify the data files you want to use for your website. [Check in the docs](https://frontmatter.codes/docs/settings/overview#frontmatter.data.files)
setting.frontMatter.data.files.items.pro: Your unique ID you want to use for your data file.
Title you want to give to your data file.
The field you want to use as label for your data entries.
Path to the file to load. Only JSON or YAML files are supported.
Defines how you want to parse the file. JSON is the default.
The JSON schema for your data which will be used to render the data form.
Defines the type of the form. Default is 'object'.
Defines the required fields for the form.
Defines the fields of the form.
If you are using data types, you can specify your type ID.
If you want to use a single entry for your data file.
setting.frontMatter.data.folders.markdow: Specify the data folders you want to use for your website. [Check in the docs](https://frontmatter.codes/docs/settings/overview#frontmatter.data.folders)
setting.frontMatter.data.folders.items.p: Your unique ID you want to use for your data folder.
The field you want to use as label for your data entries.
Path to the folder to load files.
If you are using data types, you can specify your type ID.
If you want to use a single entry for your data files in the folder.
setting.frontMatter.data.types.markdownD: Specify the data types. These types can be used in for your data files. [Check in the docs](https://frontmatter.codes/docs/settings/overview#frontmatter.data.types)
setting.frontMatter.data.types.items.pro: Your unique ID you want to use for your data type.
Specify if you want to preserve the casing of your file names from the title. [Check in the docs](https://frontmatter.codes/docs/settings/overview#frontmatter.file.preservecasing)
setting.frontMatter.framework.id.markdow: Specify the ID of your static site generator or framework you are using for your website. [Check in the docs](https://frontmatter.codes/docs/settings/overview#frontmatter.framework.id)
setting.frontMatter.framework.startComma: Specify the command you want to use to start your static site generator or framework. [Check in the docs](https://frontmatter.codes/docs/settings/overview#frontmatter.framework.startcommand)
setting.frontMatter.git.enabled.markdown: Specify if you want to use the Git actions for your website. [Check in the docs](https://frontmatter.codes/docs/settings/overview#frontmatter.git.enabled)
setting.frontMatter.git.commitMessage.ma: Specify the commit message you want to use for the sync. [Check in the docs](https://frontmatter.codes/docs/settings/overview#frontmatter.git.commitmessage)
setting.frontMatter.git.submodule.pull.m: Specify if you want to pull submodules when syncing. [Check in the docs](https://frontmatter.codes/docs/settings/overview#frontmatter.git.submodule.pull)
setting.frontMatter.git.submodule.push.m: Specify if you want to push submodules when syncing. [Check in the docs](https://frontmatter.codes/docs/settings/overview#frontmatter.git.submodule.push)
setting.frontMatter.git.submodule.branch: Specify the submodule branch to checkout. [Check in the docs](https://frontmatter.codes/docs/settings/overview#frontmatter.git.submodule.branch)
setting.frontMatter.git.submodule.folder: Specify the submodule folder of your content, this can be handy when you are using multiple submodules. [Check in the docs](https://frontmatter.codes/docs/settings/overview#frontmatter.git.submodule.folder)
setting.frontMatter.global.activeMode.ma: Specify the activated mode of Front Matter. [Check in the docs](https://frontmatter.codes/docs/settings/overview#frontmatter.global.activemode)
setting.frontMatter.global.modes.markdow: Specify the modes you want to use for Front Matter. [Check in the docs](https://frontmatter.codes/docs/settings/overview#frontmatter.global.modes)
setting.frontMatter.global.modes.items.p: The features you want to use for your mode.
setting.frontMatter.global.notifications: Specifies the notifications you want to see. By default, all notifications types will be shown. [Check in the docs](https://frontmatter.codes/docs/settings/overview#frontmatter.global.notifications)
setting.frontMatter.global.disabledNotif: This is an array with the notifications types that can be disabled for Front Matter CMS. [Check in the docs](https://frontmatter.codes/docs/settings/overview#frontmatter.global.disablednotifications)
setting.frontMatter.media.defaultSorting: Specify the default sorting option for the media dashboard. [Check in the docs](https://frontmatter.codes/docs/settings/overview#frontmatter.media.defaultsorting)
setting.frontMatter.media.supportedMimeT: Specify the mime types to support for the media files. [Check in the docs](https://frontmatter.codes/docs/settings/overview#frontmatter.media.supportedmimetypes)
setting.frontMatter.media.contentTypes.m: Specify the media content types you want to use in Front Matter. [Check in the docs](https://frontmatter.codes/docs/settings/overview#frontmatter.media.contenttypes)
setting.frontMatter.media.contentTypes.i: Define the media content types you want to use in Front Matter.
Name of the media content type
Specify the file types to allow for the media content type
Define the fields of the media content type
Title to show in the UI
Name of the field to use
setting.frontMatter.panel.freeform.markd: Specifies if you want to allow yourself from entering unknown tags/categories in the tag picker (when enabled, you will have the option to store them afterwards). Default: true. [Check in the docs](https://frontmatter.codes/docs/settings/overview#frontmatter.panel.freeform)
setting.frontMatter.panel.actions.disabl: Specify the actions you want to disable in the panel. [Check in the docs](https://frontmatter.codes/docs/settings/overview#frontmatter.panel.actions.disabled)
setting.frontMatter.preview.host.markdow: Specify the host URL (example: http://localhost:1313) to be used when opening the preview. [Check in the docs](https://frontmatter.codes/docs/settings/overview#frontmatter.preview.host)
setting.frontMatter.preview.pathName.mar: Specify the path you want to add after the host and before your slug. This can be used for instance to include the year/month like: `yyyy/MM`. The date will be generated based on the article its date field value. [Check in the docs](https://frontmatter.codes/docs/settings/overview#frontmatter.preview.pathname)
setting.frontMatter.site.baseURL.markdow: Specify the base URL of your site, this will be used for SEO checks. [Check in the docs](https://frontmatter.codes/docs/settings/overview#frontmatter.site.baseurl)
setting.frontMatter.taxonomy.alignFilena: Align the filename with the new slug when it gets generated. [Check in the docs](https://frontmatter.codes/docs/settings/overview#frontmatter.taxonomy.alignfilename)
Specifies the categories which can be used in the Front Matter. [Check in the docs](https://frontmatter.codes/docs/settings/overview#frontmatter.taxonomy.categories)
setting.frontMatter.taxonomy.commaSepara: Specify the fields names that Front Matter should treat as a comma-separated array. [Check in the docs](https://frontmatter.codes/docs/settings/overview#frontmatter.taxonomy.commaseparatedfields)
Name of the fields you want to use as comma-separated arrays.
setting.frontMatter.taxonomy.contentType: Specify the type of contents you want to use for your articles/pages/etc. Make sure the `type` is correctly set in your front matter. [Check in the docs](https://frontmatter.codes/docs/settings/overview#frontmatter.taxonomy.contenttypes)
Define the content types you want to use in Front Matter.
Define the type of field
Specifies the type of content you want to create.
Define the fields of the content type
Define the content types you want to use in Front Matter.
Define the type of field
Name of the field to use
Title to show in the UI
Description to show in the UI
Default value
Define your choices
The choice ID
The choice title
Is a single line field
Is a WYSIWYG field (HTML output)
Do you allow to select multiple values?
Specify if the image field can be used as preview. Be aware, you can only have one preview image per content type.
Do you want to hide the field from the metadata section?
The ID of your taxonomy field. It cannot contain the "tags" or "categories" value.
Specify the file extensions to allow for the file picker
The ID(s) of your field group(s) defined in the `frontMatter.taxonomy.fieldGroups` setting
The ID(s) of your data type(s) defined in the `frontMatter.data.types` setting
Specify the options for the number field
Specify if the number is a decimal
The minimum value
The maximum value
The step value
Limit the number of taxonomies to select. Set to 0 to allow unlimited.
Specify if you want to store a single array value as a string instead of an array.
Specify if the field is the publish date field
Specify if the field is the modified date field
Specify the ID of the data file to use for this field
Specify the key of the data file to use for this field
Specify the property name that will be used to show the value for the field
Specify if the field is editable
Specify if the field should encode emoji
Specify the date format to use
Specify if the field is required
Specify the content type name to filter content for the contentRelationship field
Specify the value to insert for the contentRelationship field
Specify the conditions to show the field
The field ID to use
The operator to use
The value to compare
Specify if the comparison is case sensitive. Default: true
Specify if you want to create a folder when creating new content.
Defines a custom preview path for the content type.
Defines a custom slug template for the content type.
An optional template that can be used for creating new content.
An optional post script that can be used after new content creation.
Defines a prefix for the file name.
Default file name to use when creating new content.
setting.frontMatter.taxonomy.customTaxon: Specify the custom taxonomy field data. [Check in the docs](https://frontmatter.codes/docs/settings/overview#frontmatter.taxonomy.tags)
ID for your taxonomy field. It cannot contain the "tags" or "categories" value.
Options from which you can pick.
setting.frontMatter.taxonomy.dateField.m: This setting is used to define the publishing date field of your articles. [Check in the docs](https://frontmatter.codes/docs/settings/overview#frontmatter.taxonomy.datefield)
Specify the date format for your articles. Check [date-fns formating](https://date-fns.org/v2.0.1/docs/format) for more information. [Check in the docs](https://frontmatter.codes/docs/settings/overview#frontmatter.taxonomy.dateformat)
setting.frontMatter.taxonomy.fieldGroups: Define the field groups you want to use for your block fields or collection fields. [Check in the docs](https://frontmatter.codes/docs/settings/overview#frontmatter.taxonomy.fieldgroups)
The name of the field group
The name of the field to be used as display value
setting.frontMatter.taxonomy.frontMatter: Specify the type of Front Matter to use. [Check in the docs](https://frontmatter.codes/docs/settings/overview#frontmatter.taxonomy.frontmattertype)
setting.frontMatter.taxonomy.indentArray: Specify if arrays in front matter are indented. Default: true. [Check in the docs](https://frontmatter.codes/docs/settings/overview#frontmatter.taxonomy.indentarrays)
setting.frontMatter.taxonomy.modifiedFie: This setting is used to define the modified date field of your articles. [Check in the docs](https://frontmatter.codes/docs/settings/overview#frontmatter.taxonomy.modifiedfield)
setting.frontMatter.taxonomy.quoteString: Specify if you want to quote string values in the front matter. [Check in the docs](https://frontmatter.codes/docs/settings/overview#frontmatter.taxonomy.quotestringvalues)
setting.frontMatter.taxonomy.noPropertyV: Specify the properties from which quotes need to be removed. [Check in the docs](https://frontmatter.codes/docs/settings/overview#frontmatter.taxonomy.nopropertyvaluequotes)
Name of the properties you want to remove quotes from.
setting.frontMatter.taxonomy.seoContentL: Specifies the optimal minimum length for your articles. Between 1,760 words – 2,400 is the absolute ideal article length for SEO in 2021. (set to `-1` to turn it off). [Check in the docs](https://frontmatter.codes/docs/settings/overview#frontmatter.taxonomy.seocontentlengh)
setting.frontMatter.taxonomy.seoDescript: Specifies the name of the SEO description field for your page. Default is 'description'. [Check in the docs](https://frontmatter.codes/docs/settings/overview#frontmatter.taxonomy.seodescriptionfield)
Specifies the optimal description length for SEO (set to `-1` to turn it off). [Check in the docs](https://frontmatter.codes/docs/settings/overview#frontmatter.taxonomy.seodescriptionlength)
setting.frontMatter.taxonomy.seoSlugLeng: Specifies the optimal slug length for SEO (set to `-1` to turn it off). [Check in the docs](https://frontmatter.codes/docs/settings/overview#frontmatter.taxonomy.seosluglength)
setting.frontMatter.taxonomy.seoTitleFie: Specifies the name of the SEO title field for your page. Default is 'title'. [Check in the docs](https://frontmatter.codes/docs/settings/overview#frontmatter.taxonomy.seotitlefield)
setting.frontMatter.taxonomy.seoTitleLen: Specifies the optimal title length for SEO (set to `-1` to turn it off). [Check in the docs](https://frontmatter.codes/docs/settings/overview#frontmatter.taxonomy.seotitlelength)
Specify a prefix for the slug. [Check in the docs](https://frontmatter.codes/docs/settings/overview#frontmatter.taxonomy.slugprefix)
Specify a suffix for the slug. [Check in the docs](https://frontmatter.codes/docs/settings/overview#frontmatter.taxonomy.slugsuffix)
setting.frontMatter.taxonomy.slugTemplat: Defines a custom slug template for the content you will create. [Check in the docs](https://frontmatter.codes/docs/settings/overview#frontmatter.taxonomy.slugtemplate)
setting.frontMatter.taxonomy.tags.markdo: Specifies the tags which can be used in the Front Matter. [Check in the docs](https://frontmatter.codes/docs/settings/overview#frontmatter.taxonomy.tags)
setting.frontMatter.telemetry.disable.ma: Specify if you want to disable the telemetry. [Check in the docs](https://frontmatter.codes/docs/settings/overview#frontmatter.telemetry.disable)
setting.frontMatter.templates.enabled.ma: Specify if you want to use templates. [Check in the docs](https://frontmatter.codes/docs/settings/overview#frontmatter.templates.enabled)
setting.frontMatter.templates.folder.mar: Specify the folder to use for your article templates. [Check in the docs](https://frontmatter.codes/docs/settings/overview#frontmatter.templates.folder)
setting.frontMatter.templates.prefix.mar: Specify the prefix you want to add for your new article filenames. [Check in the docs](https://frontmatter.codes/docs/settings/overview#frontmatter.templates.prefix)
setting.frontMatter.dashboard.mediaSnipp: This setting is deprecated and will be removed in the next major version. Please define your media snippet in the `frontMatter.content.snippet` setting.
setting.frontMatter.taxonomy.dateField.d: This setting is deprecated and will be removed in the next major version. Please use the new `isPublishDate` settings instead in your content types date fields.
setting.frontMatter.taxonomy.modifiedFie: This setting is deprecated and will be removed in the next major version. Please use the new `isModifiedDate` settings instead in your content types date fields.
setting.frontMatter.taxonomy.contentType: Specify the name of the custom field type to use.
Specify if the empty values should be cleared.
setting.frontMatter.website.host.markdow: Specify the host URL of your website. [Check in the docs](https://frontmatter.codes/docs/settings/overview#frontmatter.website.url)
setting.frontMatter.config.dynamicFilePa: Specify the path to the dynamic config file (ex: [[workspace]]/config.js). [Check in the docs](https://frontmatter.codes/docs/settings/overview#frontmatter.config.dynamicfilepath)
setting.frontMatter.taxonomy.contentType: Specify if the content type can be used as sub content.
Specify if the content type is sub content.
setting.frontMatter.git.disableOnBranche: Specify the branches on which you want to disable the Git actions. [Check in the docs](https://frontmatter.codes/docs/settings/overview#frontmatter.git.disableonbranches)
setting.frontMatter.git.requiresCommitMe: Specify if you want to require a commit message when publishing your changes for a specified branch. [Check in the docs](https://frontmatter.codes/docs/settings/overview#frontmatter.git.requirescommitmessage)
